column1: 1. The updated model with weighted Intent (70%) and Consideration (30%) shows a modest positive impact on the forecast compared to the previous model.
2. The Brand Health Multiplier increased from 1.00 to 1.02
column2: resulting in higher forecasts across all scenarios.

column1: 3. The forecast shows a distinct monthly pattern with strong growth in Q1 and Q4
4. The Intent/Consideration ratio is projected to remain relatively stable from Q4 2024 (0.67) to Q4 2025 (0.66).
5. The multi-factor approach with enhanced brand metrics shows significantly higher growth (6.4% to 18.0%) compared to the ARIMA model (1.6%).
1. Higher Overall Growth: Average YoY growth increased from 1.6% to 6.4% in Conservative
2. More Pronounced Seasonality: Higher peaks in high-seasonality months and lower troughs in low-seasonality months.
3. Brand Health Impact: Brand Health Multiplier increased from 1.00 to 1.02
column2: reflecting the higher weight given to Intent growth.

column1: 4. Conversion Efficiency: Added factor provides more nuanced view of the relationship between Consideration and Intent.
- All values are indexed to a baseline of 100 representing the average monthly query volume in 2023.
- YoY Growth represents the percentage change from 2024 to 2025 for each scenario.
